column1: Concepción (Spanish pronunciation: [konsepˈsjon]) is a city & district in northern Paraguay and capital of the Concepción Department. It lies next to the Paraguay River.

column3: the town prospered in the early years of the 20th century
column4: as a centre for the north of the country
column5: exploiting the new wealth of the Gran Chaco
column6: and a river port. The town was also a centre for the Paraguayan Civil War of 1947. The city is the seat of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Concepción en Paraguay.

column1: Route 5 "Gral. Bernardino Caballero" connects the city with Pedro Juan Caballero and Asunción.
Concepción has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen: Aw) with abundant annual precipitation
column2: although possessing a highly prominent summer peak. Summers are very hot
column3: rainy and often oppressively humid. Severe thunderstorms are very common in the summer
column4: and have the capability to dump copious amounts of rainfall in a short period of time
column5: along with destructively high winds and occasional hail. Winter is much drier and considerably cooler
column6: with near drought-like conditions often prevailing. Concepcion is also located in very close proximity to the Tropic of Capricorn
column7: with the latitudinal line lying just south of the city.
